message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is about statistical language modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of smoothing techniques, which is a common approach in machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR) to overcome data sparsity. The comparison of different smoothing techniques also involves evaluating their performance, which is a common task in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE).
